ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: This class is based around group work, the instructor did not lecture more than twice. Any feedback from the instructor was based on her firm beliefs and she was not flexible to different styles of writing or alternative views. It was slightly oppressive.
The class was alright. Depends a lot on your project and your partner. Some of the speakers were good. Others, not so much.
Ability to work on an interesting project for a high-profile client.
Can learn much about client management and presentation skills
Great opportunity to work with a client.
Real consulting experience
Getting a resume bullet that fit my career goals.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: Managing the individual group project loads against the class assignments. We were often asked to do update presentations that took too much time away from our client work.
Screening the projects, ensuring that clients have clear needs and all students have useful work to do. I think Maureen is great at this, but there is always room for improvement.
Group work can be challenging. Not sure how to adjust for this.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Instructor was always willing to meet or look over work.
Maureen is great.
Instructor extremely responsive.
We meet the instructor once a week.
Maureen always replied promptly to emails.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Great opportunity to learn how to handle a client.
Fits great. Like I said, it gave me a solid resume bullet.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To brush up on consulting skills.
Capstone requirement for MEM.Great opportunity to get consulting experience with a new client.
Opportunity to work with an incredible client.
Looked interesting.
Just for auditing

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: No. It turned into managing class expectations against the real world expectations of our client.
Yes!
Exceeded, as our group had the opportunity to present to the CEO.
Yes, I learnt a lot about dealing with clients
This survey is starting to get ridiculous

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes!
No, but that was the client's fault, not Maureen's.
Yes.
I didn't really have any expectations, so, sure!

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: -Advantages: learning to deal with people who do not have a work ethic or have very weak skills-Disadvantages: working with people who lack in a strong work ethic or have very weak skills.
Working in groups is very representative of real world work situations.
Learned from my teammates, but group dynamics can be challenging.
I learnt a lot from my teammate who has a different set of skills with me.
Spreading the work load -- dividing and conquering.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It all depends on your group and your ability to deal with arbitrary rules.
Only take it if the project interests you.
See if there'sa project you like, and get lunch before you go to class.
